aurem.description:
About the Project

Aurem Genus is an assistive technology solution designed to transform hybrid and distance education. Born from the need for inclusion, the project goes beyond a traditional video conferencing platform: it is an ecosystem focused on breaking communication barriers through real-time captioning and interactive pedagogical tools.

The platform serves three educational pillars (Students, Teachers, and Institutions), offering everything from a full LMS (Learning Management System) to an immersive virtual classroom where the teacher's voice is instantly converted to text, ensuring accessibility for hearing-impaired people and cognitive reinforcement for all students.

Architecture and Software Engineering

The Aurem ecosystem operates under a distributed and scalable architecture, divided into three main fronts:

1. Web Client & Interactive Room (SPA)

The heart of the interaction is a robust Single Page Application developed in React.

  • State Management: Utilization of Redux to orchestrate complex classroom states (who is speaking, current slide, user permissions).
  • Interactivity: Implementation of a collaborative Digital Whiteboard using Fabric.js, where drawings and annotations are vectorized and synchronized among all clients.
  • Multimedia: Manipulation of integrated PDFs and video/audio streams.

2. Desktop Client (Electron)

For scenarios where the user needs captions outside the browser (such as in PowerPoint presentations or external software), a Desktop client was developed with Electron.

  • Transparent Overlay: The application uses frameless windows with transparency and click-through support, allowing captions to float over other applications without obstructing the user's work.
  • IPC Communication: Architecture of inter-process communication (Main and Renderer) to manage floating windows, chat, and authentication simultaneously.

3. Backend and Infrastructure

The backbone of the system is a RESTful API in Node.js/Express.

  • Real-Time Communication: Use Socket.io (WebSockets) to ensure sub-second latency in caption delivery and classroom event synchronization (slide changes, chat, drawings).
  • Hybrid Persistence: MySQL (Sequelize) for structured data; MongoDB for logs and captions; Redis for caching and queues.
The Artificial Intelligence Core

The technical differentiator of the project is the audio-to-text processing pipeline.

  • Capture: Audio is captured on the client (Web or Desktop).
  • Cloud Processing: Direct integration with Azure Cognitive Services.
  • Smart Fallback: Automatic switching to native Web Speech API in case of failures.
  • Broadcast: Immediate distribution via WebSocket.
Challenges and Highlights
  • Synchronization: Ensuring real-time collaborative drawing.
  • Desktop UX: Creating windows "invisible" to the mouse but visible to the eyes with Electron.
  • DevOps: Automated CI/CD, Docker, and orchestration on AWS.

wind-energy.description:
About the Project

Wind Energy software project developed in C++, designed to conduct viability studies and implementation planning for wind farms. Acting as a strategic engineering tool, the system calculates the energy efficiency of different terrains, focusing not just on "where" to place turbines, but "how much" the land can yield.

Engineering and Algorithms

The project solves geometric optimization and physics problems:

  • Packing Algorithms: Mathematical implementation to maximize the number of turbines in irregular terrains (Trapezoids and Triangles).
  • Applied Physics: Application of formulas such as the Betz Limit and air density calculations to transform raw wind data into precise electrical power predictions.

scaling-x.description:
About the Project

Scaling-X is a comprehensive visual identity project that translates the values of Commitment and Growth into a modern graphic language. The design centers on the company's mission: to be the cloud partner that empowers clients to reach their best version.

Visual Identity & Colors

The palette was carefully selected to balance vibrancy with minimalist professionalism:

  • ScalingX Blue (#01ACE0): A vibrant and distinct color evoking innovation.
  • Deep Black (#01001F) & White: The contrast that brings elegance, seriousness, and modernity.
Typography & Logotype

Every textual detail was crafted to communicate stability and future:

  • Dubai Font: Chosen for its symmetry and modern strokes, emphasizing the brand's innovative nature.
  • Wordmark: A strong logo that symbolizes scalability, reaffirming the commitment to continuous growth.

maincore.description:
About the Project

End-to-end development of the corporate portal for Maincore, a specialist in high-performance hardware solutions. The goal was to create a modern, fast, and SEO-optimized digital platform capable of showcasing complex products and effectively capturing qualified leads.

My Role

I served as the Frontend Developer, responsible for the pixel-perfect interface implementation and code architecture. The focus was on transforming the design system into a high-fidelity, high-performance web application.

Implementation Highlights
  • Architecture: Adoption of Compound Component patterns to facilitate reuse and maintenance.
  • Enhanced UX: Rich visual feedback, notifications via react-toastify, and complex form validations with Formik.
  • Quality & Testing: Unit test coverage using Jest and React Testing Library.
